Circlet of Energy Absorption (Rare) v6.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

"The fiery passions of the sun cool the whispers of the air, while the earth's secrets of life are embraced by the water's weaves. This is the eternal symphony of the elements."

This magic circlet radiate elemental energy. A large thin halo hovers above your head while you wear it. The circlet has 3 charges.

Damage Resistance. As a bonus action you can expend 1 charge to gain resistance from: fire, cold, lightning and thunder damage for 1 minute. If you take damage from an attack/spell that you have resistance, the effect ends and the halo above your head absorbs some of the incoming energy.

Release Energy. You release the energy stored in the halo, the first time you hit with an attack on your next turn. The target takes an extra [[/r 2d8]] damage of the damage type you resisted.

Void Vortex (Rare) v8.description:
Weapon (longbow), rare (requires attunement)

"You remain within or behind or beyond or above, invisible, out of existence, indifferent, but out of nothing, everything."

The arrow causes gravity to collapse, creating a vortex which bursts shortly after its formation, dealing [[/r 4d8]] force damage in a 20-foot radius. Glove of Divine Light (Legendary) v3.name: Glove of Divine Light (Legendary) v3
Glove of Divine Light (Legendary) v3.description:
Wondrous item, legendary (requires attunement by a good-aligned spellcaster)

“Oh, radiant hope, divine and true,
When shadows loom and sunlight's through,
May those who strive for what is just,
Find solace in your sacred trust.

With grace bestowed upon the hand,
By noble hearts, by courage grand,
Its wearer wields a sacred might,
With powers blessed, with radiant light.

Bathed in light, we stand as one,
A noble fight, our battles won.
But choices made, both right and wrong,
Can echo in our life's sweet song."

The glove grants a +3 bonus to melee spell attack rolls.

This magical glove is made of a pure white material that never gets dirty. It is adorned with golden trim, and when worn by a good-aligned creature it radiates a warm and comforting light.

Sacred Purification. As an action, you can reach out and touch a creature within 5 feet. The target must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes radiant damage equal to [[/r 1d10]] + [[/r 1d10]] for each level of your class. If the creature has less than half of its maximum hit points and fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is instantly slain and a random side effect is triggered on you. If the creature makes a successful save, it only takes half the damage.

After using this ability you must recite the prayer in daylight to use it again.

A wondrous lamp ignites the night."

Vision through the Veil. While active, your melee weapon attacks deal an additional 2 radiant damage to all creatures within the illuminated area and you can sense invisible creatures within this light. However, any attempts to attack them are done with disadvantage.

As an action you can expend 1 charge and restore [[/r 4d4]] hit points to a creature you can touch with the palm of your hand.

Shadows Refuge (Light Armor) v6.description:
Armor (light armor), legendary (requires attunement)

“The bandit walked down the dimly lit street, his heart pounding in his chest. He couldn't shake the feeling that someone, or something, was following him. He continued to look over his shoulder, but all he could see was his own shadow, elongated by the flickering street lamps. Suddenly, he heard a voice whisper in his ear, "No matter how fast you run, you can't outrun the shadows." The man froze in horror. He felt a cold blade piercing his back, pain rushing through his body. He looked down and saw the blade coming out from his chest and blood pouring out, staining the pavement. He knew it was too late for forgiveness.”

You have a +2 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. While attuned to it you have advantage on Stealth checks.

Shadow Dwelling. As a bonus action, you can select the shadow of a creature within a maximum range of 30 feet that you can see. You inhabit that creature's shadow for up to 1 minute or until you choose to end it. While in the shadow, your vision becomes monochromatic, and your vision range is limited to 5 feet. You gain immunity to all damage but you are vulnerable to Radiant damage. You can only be seen with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.eVtpEGXjA2tamEIJ.JournalEntryPage.8iC24otVX4n1yrYw]{Truesight} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.eVtpEGXjA2tamEIJ.JournalEntryPage.I6ABWHBYwGl55dLY]{Blindsight}.

Exhaustion. When you step out of the shadow, you gain 1 level of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cspWveykstnu3Zcv]{Exhaustion}. Every time you use your action, you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 15) to maintain your presence within the shadow. On a failed save, you automatically step out from the shadow.

Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Deadly Strike. As an action, you can make one attack from the creature's shadow and you can only target the creature whose shadow you currently inhabit. This attack has advantage and deals triple damage. If you reduce the target to 0 hit points with this attack, you can use "Shadow Dwelling" again on your next turn.

Glove of Healing Slap (Very Rare) v2.description:

"A slap to heal, a grin to seal, and a hand-shaped trace to embrace. This glove is the jest of jests, and it'll leave you with a face that's truly blessed!"

This magical glove is made from leather in shades of green, red, and yellow, adorned with colorful, jester-themed patterns and bells that jingle with each movement.

Healing Slap. While wearing these gloves, you can take an action to deliver a vigorous slap on a willing or incapacitated creature within 5 feet of you. The creature regains hit points equal to [[/roll 4d6]] plus your Wisdom modifier. The slap leaves a comically shaped handprint on the creature's face, which fades away after 4 hours. Warden of Past Moments v7.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

"Remember timekeeper, moments once passed are not gone, but merely await our return."

This pocket clock is crafted from gemstones and precious metals. The watch face is a miniature work of art, displaying the numbers of the hours as ancient constellation symbols that glow softly in the dark. When you look closely, the second hand seems to jitter, as if hesitating to move forward. The pocket clock irresistibly draws the eye when displayed.

Temporal Reaction. Once per long rest, if you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to activate the pocket clock. You are then teleported back to the position you occupied at the start of your last turn, and you take no damage from the attack.
If the attack was a melee attack, the attacker must succeed on a Perception check (DC 12) or become incapacitated until the end of its next turn, left reeling in confusion by your vanishing act.
If you choose to use your reaction while remaining in the same location as the previous round, the item fails to teleport you, and you'll still take the attack's damage as usual.

Temporal Quickstep. You gain a +5 bonus to initiative rolls, always seeming to act just a moment before others.

Yarte Pora (Legendary) v3.description:
Weapon (halberd), legendary (requires attunement)

“The sky lights up with a breathtaking display of light. Glowing figures, possessing godlike powers, fight and destroy everything in their path. In the center of it all, a single beam of light descends onto an ancient weapon hovering above the ground, radiating warm and pure energy. Only the worthy can see this vision, as it is a sign of destiny.”

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

You have advantage on melee attacks against fiends and undead creatures.

The halberd is crafted from an unidentified metal and has a long, curved blade at one end and a sharp, hooked blade at the other.

Luminous Vitality (Active Ability). As an action, you can choose a friendly creature within 5 feet of you and heal it for a value equal to the amount of health you are currently missing. You can use this ability once per long rest.

Luminous Manifestation (Active Ability). As a bonus action, you can transform your body into a radiant entity for 1 minute. Choose a fiend or undead creature within your line of sight and focus your attacks on it for the duration. Your body detonates in a burst of light, forcing creatures within a 10-foot radius to make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.0b8N4FymGGfbZGpJ]{Blinded} until the end of their next turn. Your non-magical items are destroyed in the explosion, while your magical equipment is scattered within a 10-foot radius around you.

  • While in Luminous Manifestation form:

    • Your body hovers and emanates bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
    • You gain resistance to all forms of damage.
    • You become immune to the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.oreoyaFKnvZCrgij]{Frightened} condition.
    • You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and your weapon deals an additional 2d10 + 1 radiant damage. In the case of a critical miss, reroll the attack.

To use Luminous Manifestation ability again, you must spend 24 hours in quiet contemplation and prayer in a secluded place.

Bloodseeker's Vengeance (Rare) v2.description:
Weapon (shortbow), rare (requires attunement)

"Just as my blood is the essence of life, my bow is the essence of death, wielding arrows that know no mercy."

Bloodseeker's Vengeance is a sinister-looking shortbow with carvings of veins and arteries along its limbs.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Bloodforged Arrows. When you draw the string of Bloodseeker's Vengeance, you sacrifice 2 hit points to create a blood arrow. This arrow, when fired, deals 1d6 piercing damage and 1d6 necrotic damage on a successful hit. You can choose to sacrifice additional hit points, up to a maximum of 8, to enhance the power of the blood arrow. For every 2 hit points sacrificed, the arrow's necrotic damage increases by 1d6, up to a maximum of 4d6 for 8 hit points sacrificed.

If creating a Bloodforged Arrow causes your hit points to drop to 0 you fall unconscious and the arrow fails to hit its target.

After hitting a creature with a blood arrow, you regain 1d6 hit points.

When the blood arrow strikes, a pool of blood forms at the creature's feet. This pool creates difficult terrain in a 5-foot radius around that creature until the start of your next turn, as the blood congeals and spreads.

Curse of Macabre Attraction. The magic of the bow draws you closer to death's realm. You have vulnerability to necrotic damage and undead creatures are unnaturally drawn to you, often seeking you out in combat.

Curse of the Blood Reaper. The bow's insatiable appetite for blood becomes consuming. Whenever you roll a natural 20 with a blood arrow, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you shoot another Bloodforged Arrow at its maximum power, sacrificing 16 hit points instead of 8. If you have no enemy creature in range, you choose the nearest friendly creature as your target. This arrow does not grant any healing property. If creating this arrow causes your hit points to drop to 0, you fall unconscious.

"As the enemy approached, Captain Abelard raised his warhammer, with a determined look on his face. "You'll not be getting any closer, friend," he said with a smirk. The enemy charged forward, only to be knocked back by a sudden force. "What was that?" he asked. "Oh, just a little something I call Distanceectomy," replied Abelard, winking. "It has a way of keeping people from getting too close."

The hammerhead is crafted in the shape of two palms in a stop position, as if halting the enemy in their tracks. In the center of the hammer's head rests a gemstone, radiating a faint purple hue that seems to shift and change with the light.

Sentinel's Ward. While wielding this shield, you can't be @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.oreoyaFKnvZCrgij]{Frightened}.

Destabilizator (Rare Warhammer) v8.description:
Weapon (warhammer), rare (requires attunement)

"As the enemy approached, Captain Abelard raised his warhammer, with a determined look on his face. "You'll not be getting any closer, friend," he said with a smirk. The enemy charged forward, only to be knocked back by a sudden force. "What was that?" he asked. "Oh, just a little something I call Distanceectomy," replied Abelard, winking. "It has a way of keeping people from getting too close."

The hammerhead is crafted in the shape of two palms in a stop position, as if halting the enemy in their tracks. In the center of the hammer's head rests a gemstone, radiating a faint purple hue that seems to shift and change with the light.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This warhammer requires 16 Strength or higher to wield.

Destabilizing Attack (Passive Ability). Every time you hit with this hammer, and if the target size is Tiny, Small, Medium or Large, it must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you push the target 5 feet away from you and it takes [[/r 1d8]] force damage. On a successful save, the target takes only half of the force damage and is not pushed away.

Tempestfury v6.name: Tempestfury v6
Tempestfury v6.description:
Weapon (mace), very rare (requires attunement)

"Thunder may roar, thunder may awe, but it's lightning that truly gets the job done."

Tempestwrath and Tempestfury, the Maces of Tempest, are a remarkable departure from typical maces. "Forged entirely from metal, they pulse with restrained energy, eager to be set free. These massive maces have been crafted to feel surprisingly light in your hands. Their balance and design make them perfectly suited for dual-wielding.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

While attuned and wielding both weapons, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack when engaging in two-weapon fighting.

Lightning Surge. If both maces hit the same target on a single turn, the latent lightning within the maces is activated. The target takes an additional 2d6 lightning damage and you can use Onslaught on your next turn.

Onslaught. Unleash a full onslaught with both maces on a single target, using your action, bonus action, and any additional free actions that grant attacks. If you do so, add 2 more attacks to your assault. The maximum number of attacks cannot surpass 10.

Curse. Once attuned to the Maces of Tempest, they cannot be unattuned without the aid of a remove curse spell or similar magic. Your presence draws storms wherever you go. You cannot take long rests outdoors, as storms continually disrupt your rest.

"A ring of silver and gold, a celestial tale intricately told. By sunlight's grace, healing springs forth, while night's embrace secrets untold.”

Blending the beauty of gold and silver in its craftsmanship, the ring features two distinct female faces, skillfully sculpted to represent the celestial bodies of the sun and the moon.

The Nux Hemera possesses 2 charges, all replenished following a long rest.

As an action you can expend 1 charge and restore [[/r 2d4]] hit points to a creature you can touch with the palm of your hand.

After sunset, the essence of the ring shifts. When used to heal at night, it instead deals [[/r 2d4]] necrotic damage to the creature.

Pyro Head - The Infernal Crown (Legendar.description:
Wondrous Item, legendary (requires attunement by a fighter, sorcerer, wizard, warlock or rogue)

"There is a fire inside. Watch the flames, the ancient, flickering of the relic's essence and become reborn."

The Infernal Crown, known also as the Pyro Head, is a relic forged in the heart of a extinguished volcano. The helm resembles a skull engulfed in flames.

Ember Gaze. As an action, you can unleash a gaze attack from the Pyro Head. Three rays shoot forth from the helm's eyes and mouth, targeting the nearest three creatures within a 30-foot cone. Each targeted creature must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 17). On a failed save, the creature takes 6d6 fire damage. On a successful save, they take half damage. If a creature dies from this attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to the damage the creature took.

This ability can be use twice per long rest.

Firewalk. You gain the ability to walk on the surface of lava or other molten substances as if they were solid ground. You leave no trail of fire behind and you are unharmed by the heat.

Inferno Barrier. You are immune to environmental heat damage and resistant to any fire-based attacks or spells.

Intimidating Aura. You gain a +5 bonus to Intimidation checks and a -5 penalty to Persuasion checks.

Curse. When the Infernal Crown is donned, the helm fuses with you, becoming unremovable. During this time, your head takes the appearance of a burning skull, wreathed in fire (the fire is harmless and does not emit heat and light). The helm cannot be removed as long as you live.

Blood Shroud Breastplate (Very Rare) v2.description:
Armor (medium armor), very rare (requires attunement)

"We are all born of blood. It is the principal element of life, yet within it, we find the essence of death."

This magical armor appears to be finely crafted from dark, blood-red metal that radiates an aura of power and ancient magic.

You have a +2 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

Blood Transmutation. As an action, you can morph the armor into a mist of flowing crimson blood that lasts until the end of your next turn. While in this form, your movement speed is reduced by half, and you gain the following benefits:

  • Blood Burst. As you morph the armor, all creatures within a 5-foot radius must make a Constitution saving throw, DC 15. On a failed save, they take 4d6 necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful save.

  • Vampiric Fortitude. You gain immunity to piercing, slashing, and bludgeoning damage until the end of your next turn.

You can use this ability twice per long rest.

Curse. Attuning to this armor curses you until you are targeted by a Greater Restoration spell or similar magic; removing the armor fails to end the curse. While cursed, you are vulnerable to radiant damage and you must roleplay the character as constantly annoyed and uncomfortable in natural light. Your behavior should reflect irritation, making interactions in brightly lit areas more challenging and influencing your decision-making process during gameplay.

Clockwork Heart (Very Rare) v3.name: Clockwork Heart (Very Rare) v3
Clockwork Heart (Very Rare) v3.description:
Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement)

"Few things in this world are rarer than magic, yet an artwork infused with magic is a treasure beyond compare."

Clockwork Heart is a gold crafted magical artifact resembling a full-sized heart. This magnificent creation, from the ornate clocks to the myriad of tiny gears and various mechanical components, has been crafted to evoke a sense of both artistry and functionality.

When attuned, the Clockwork Heart transcends its physical form, merging with your heart, becoming an integral part of your body.

Art Collector's Intuition. You can appraise the value of art objects with uncanny accuracy.

The Clockwork Heart has a total of 10 charges, and each of its abilities can be activated as a bonus action. It regains [[/r 2d4 + 2]] expended charges after a long rest. If you consume all of the charges, you suffer one level of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cspWveykstnu3Zcv]{Exhaustion}.

When you activate abilities, your form briefly shudders, and you become enveloped in golden, patterns.

  • Gears of Haste (6 charges). Consume 6 charges to dramatically increase your heart rate, allowing you to take an additional action on your current turn.

  • Radiant Flourish (5 charges). Consume 5 charges to imbue your weapons with radiant energy for 1 minute, granting a +1 bonus to attack and 1d6 extra radiant damage on each hit.

  • Mechanical Strike (5 charges). Consume 5 charges to gain an extra attack on your current turn.

  • Swift Gearshift (4 charges). Consume 4 charges to double your movement speed on your current turn.

Side Effect:

  • Artistic Obsession. You develop an overwhelming love for art. You become emotionally invested in the preservation and appreciation of art, to the point where you can become visibly upset when encountering art in poor condition or being mistreated. This obsession can lead you to take extraordinary measures to protect and restore art, even to the detriment of your other goals or relationships.

Roleplay Suggestions:

  • You might find yourself constantly seeking out art galleries, museums, and rare collectors to ensure their art is well-maintained.
  • You may become a patron of the arts, supporting struggling artists and funding art restoration projects.
  • Your emotional reactions to damaged or neglected art can lead to humorous or tense situations in social interactions, especially when others don't share your passion for art.
  • The curse could drive you to investigate art-related mysteries and quests, uncovering hidden truths about valuable pieces and their creators.
